TopicTitle: A built in lighting control panel for in flight

Articles.Content:
A built in lighting control panel for in flight such that the pilot can turn on or off (in any color)

every light on the ship. Perhaps a unique # for each light and name-user supplied similar to the

Infernal Robotics IR control system does for hinges & docking washers.

The going around and right clicking on each one is just wrong.

Thanks

A built in lighting control panel for in flight such that the pilot can turn on or off (in any color)

every light on the ship.

Um, you mean all at once, or just a centralized control panel that lets you easily select them? Because we do have the 'all at once' thing with the light button/light key (defaults to 'U' key).

Although..that might not work if you don't have at least a second tier VAB :/

No the U key is for all reguardless.

"or just a centralized control panel that lets you easily select them?"

yes a control panel to end the right click to turn it on or off in flight

I would LOVE to see some sort of hierarchical menu for the parts that makes up your craft. Instead of needing to click every individual part, it could be split up into either a tree menu of items, or a contextual menu for each objects function(Just like the VAB part bin.)
I like the tree structure of a control panel Programmable of course.
Ships manifest comes close to solving the clicking
